Key Match Events: Freddie Freeman blasted a two-run home run in the first inning
Alex Verdugo's two-run homer with two outs in the ninth
Walker Buehler pitched five scoreless innings
Nestor Cortes retired Shohei Ohtani and Mookie Betts in the bottom of the fourth
Pre-Game Insights: Dodgers infielder Max Muncy said, 'If you keep the best player in the game in the lineup, that's usually good for your team.'
Muncy said Ohtani informed teammates late Saturday night he would be available this week in New York.
Ohtani was hurt sliding into second base when he was caught stealing to end the seventh inning of Saturday night's 4-2 victory in Game 2 at Los Angeles.
Post-Match Reflections: The Dodgers hold a commanding 3-0 series lead and can clinch the franchise's eighth world championship with a win in Game 4 on Tuesday.

The Yankees' starting pitching was, seemingly, one of their biggest advantages entering this series. Through three innings of Game 3, Buehler has yet to allow a run while Schmidt is already out of the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The crowd was already a little nervous and on edge before the first pitch, what with the Yankees being down 0-2 and needing a fast start in Game 3.
Freddie Freeman has done it again. His two-run shot, this one on a two-strike pitch, is his third straight game with a homer to start the 2024 World Series.
The Yankees jumbotron is imploring the crowd to'make some noise,' but it's the Yankees bats that have to get loud.
